Uses of Class
org.azeckoski.reflectutils.ClassProperty

Packages that use ClassProperty
org.azeckoski.reflectutils A set of reflection utilities and miscellaneous utilities related to working with classes and their fields with no dependencies which is compatible with java 1.5 and generics. 
 

Uses of ClassProperty in org.azeckoski.reflectutils
 

Subclasses of ClassProperty in org.azeckoski.reflectutils
static class ClassProperty.IndexedProperty
          Slightly extended version with the extra indexed properties, indexed getters and setters must be setup like so:
If the fieldName is "thing" then:
getter: Object getThing(int index) and setter: void setThing(int index, Object value)
static class ClassProperty.MappedProperty
          Slightly extended version with the extra mapped properties, mapped getters and setters must be setup like so:
If the fieldName is "thing" then:
getter: Object getThing(String key) and setter: void setThing(String key, Object value)
The keys MUST be Strings
 

Methods in org.azeckoski.reflectutils that return ClassProperty
 ClassProperty ClassFields.getClassProperty(String name)
          SPECIAL METHOD: accesses the internal data
Returns a field property object for any field (not limited to only complete fields)
 

Methods in org.azeckoski.reflectutils that return types with arguments of type ClassProperty
 Map<String,ClassProperty> ClassFields.getAllClassProperties()
          SPECIAL METHOD: accesses the internal data
Gets all the cached class properties objects related to this class
WARNING: Special method which allows access to the internal properties storage structure, this should really only be used for filtering results in a way that is not supported by the standard class fields methods
 

Methods in org.azeckoski.reflectutils with parameters of type ClassProperty
protected  void FieldUtils.assignFieldValue(Object obj, ClassProperty cp, Object value)
          This will set the value on a field, types must match, for internal use only, Reduce code duplication
protected  Object FieldUtils.findFieldValue(Object obj, ClassProperty cp)
          This will get the value from a field, for internal use only, Reduce code duplication
 boolean ClassFields.isFieldInFilter(ClassProperty cp, ClassFields.FieldsFilter filter)
